column2: Adds support for creating state machines for attributes on any Ruby class

column5: message

Merge pull request #247 from lichtamberg/master

Fix typo in README example
Update to latest version of appraisal, renaming gemfiles according to new spec
Fix missing dependency require in EventCollection
Raise InvalidContext error when the current state does not define a state-driven behavior. Closes #196
Update State tests to only validate usage of super in state-driven behaviors in Ruby 1.9.1+
Fix target state being indeterminate for transitions that use blacklists
Allow super to be called within state-driven behaviors
Tag v1.2.0 release
Allow multiple whitelisted / blacklisted :to states when definining transitions. Closes #197
Update active_record 4.0.0 appraisal to latest beta
Clarify Symbols vs. Strings section in README as it pertains to state values
Add tests validating association autosave behavior for mongomapper, mongoid, and sequel integrations
Fix event attributes not being processed when saved via association autosaving. Closes #157
Add tests validating association initialization behavior for all ORM integrations
Fix some data_mapper appraisals not having the right extlib dependencies
Fix Mongoid integration not setting initial state attributes properly for associations
Fix Mongoid tests not writing out to a log file for debugging
Include additional caveats on DataMapper, Rubinius usage
Add notes on versions / implementations of Ruby officially support

Completely rewrite ORM action hooks to behave more consistently across the board. Closes #201, closes #214, closes #219, closes #230
* Change transitions to be executed the same whether using ORM save actions or not
* Fix around_transition callbacks not being executed properly in ORM integrations
* Fix additional transitions not being able to be fired in transition callbacks
* Add documentation on the order in which transition callbacks run within ORM integrations
Update tests so that appraisals can be run in parallel

Fix some appraisals / tests failing on Ruby 2.0.0 / Rubinius / JRuby
Change Transition.pause_supported? to whitelist Ruby engines instead of blacklist them
Fix some MongoMapper tests failing on older versions of the ORM
Fix ActiveRecord dup specs which don't work on 3.0.x
Add tests that validate the persistence of default static / dynamic state values
Fix / update ActiveModel / ActiveRecord appraisals
Update appraisals / tests to run on jruby and rubinius implementations
Add .rbx to gitignore
Fix typo in Event test causing failures
Update README to include a topic on explicit vs. implicit event transitions. Closes #225
Update Travis CI configuration to run mongodb, test rbx-18mode / rbx-19mode, and disable integration tests on jruby
Fix around_transition pausing not being marked as unsupported for rubinius
Fix Sequel state-driven validation tests

Merge pull request #228 from sanemat/fix/machine-with-action-undefined-test

Fix some Machine tests failing under Ruby 2.0.0
Fix dynamic definition example in README not properly handling state initialization / action failures. #132
Fix all / any / same matchers not being able to be used in :from / :to options in transitions and callbacks. Closes #190
Update data_mapper appraisals
Add link in README to list of supported output formats for graphs, including note on resolution issues
Fix incorrect escaping in gemspec when reading .gitignore
Remove dependency on command-line git binaries from within the gemspec. Closes #199
Update active_record appraisals, fix active_record tests failing for latest 4.0.0 beta
Update sequel appraisals
Update active_model appraisals, fix tests not working on latest 4.0.0 beta
Update minimum required ruby-graphviz version to 0.9.17, fix deprecation warnings on ruby-graphviz 1.0.3+
Add appraisals for mongo_mapper 0.11.2 and 0.12.0
Fix aliased fields in Mongoid 2.4.0+ not being automatically detected. Closes #204
Add tests to validate the functionality of Mongoid observers
Add Mongoid 3.0.0+ support. Closes #203, Closes #232

Add respond_to? second argument true for protected method

respond_to? against a protected method now returns false unless
the second argument is true.
https://github.com/ruby/ruby/blob/trunk/NEWS
Update Rails examples based on latest scaffold generator
Fix scopes getting generated multiple times when the singular / plural machine names are the same but of a different type (symbol vs. string). Closes #183
Only generate warnings when the db default for a state attribute is different than that defined for the state machine. Closes #185
Add initial support for ActiveRecord / ActiveModel 4.0.0 beta
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:pluginaweek/state_machine
Fix tests failing for latest versions of MongoMapper, Mongoid, and Sequel

Merge pull request #181 from nblumoe/patch-1

Fix GraphViz being linked to incorrectly in the README
Link to GraphViz.org fixed
Fix static initial states always being set even when the state has already been initialized in non-ORM integrations. Closes #169
Generate a warning when both the ORM's backend and state_machine define the initial state for an attribute. #174
Fix all Ruby warnings generated by state_machine. Closes #167
Add caveat on firing events within DataMapper hooks. #164
Add a caveat note on using transition callbacks with delegates
Document usage of requiring state_machine, state_machine/core, and state_machine/core_ext
Add additional notes that the YARD integration will only work for Ruby 1.9+
Fix callbacks not working for methods that respond via method_missing. Closes #159
Remove accidental usage of Symbol#to_proc to fix Ruby 1.8.6 compatibility
Fix observer callbacks being run when disabled in ActiveModel / ActiveRecord integrations. Closes #162
Fix nil states / machine actions not being interpreted properly in YARD integration
Register state event attributes in YARD integration

Refactor StateMachine::YARD::Handlers::Machine to simplify various interactions
Fix event class types being used as the required type for state-related method arguments
Register machine attributes as actually attributes
Remove dependency on ActiveSupport / Proc extension

Merge pull request #160 from michaelklishin/patch-1

Update .travis.yml to pass travis-lint validation
Remove paths from .gitignore that are no longer necessary
Update .travis.yml to pass [travis-lint](http://about.travis-ci.org/docs/user/travis-lint/) validation
Replace rcov with simplecov (enable during tests via COVERAGE environment variable)
Don't document a machine's attribute reader / writer if the attribute is manually defined in the class
Don't document a machine's attribute reader / writer if the attribute is automatically defined by the ORM integration being used
Simplify availability / class matching implementation for integrations
Rename Macro YARD handler to Machine

Simplify YARD integration by using state_machine itself to manage parsed states / events / transitions
Fix 'same' loopback matcher not being handled properly
Fix NilClass possibly being used for return types of state methods
Don't document methods that get inherited; only those that are generated
Don't document states / events that are inherited from parent machines
Add YARD integration for autogenerating documentation / embedding visualizations of state machines (inspired by @justinlynn / yard-state_machine)
Fix StateMachine::Machine#transition modifying options that are passed in
Update appraisals
Allow states / events to be drawn with their human name instead of their internal name. Closes #154
Tag 1.1.2 release
Update active_model / active_record 3.2.0 appraisals

Merge pull request #153 from laserlemon/patch-1

Add dependency status image via Gemnasium to README
Add dependency status image via Gemnasium to README
Fix states not being initialized properly on ActiveRecord 3.2+. Closes #150
Fix deprecation warning in ActiveRecord tests for using set_table_name
Update gemfiles
Tag 1.1.1 release
Update license
Minor readme changes
Remove markup provider override in yardopts since redcarpet is now the default
Fix fields being defined for Mongoid / MongoMapper state attributes even if they're already defined in the model. Closes #145
Fix nil being interpreted as an conflicting state name type

Raise error when states / events are referenced in a definition with different types (e.g. both Strings and Symbols). Closes #144
Add documentation regarding the consistency of state / event names. Closes #146
Add missing changelog entries

Allow all indexed values in state / event collections (such as name, qualified name, etc.) to be looked up by their string / symbol equivalent so as to support values from external sources (like browsers) being supported the same
Update gemfiles
Allow state_machine to be loaded without extensions to the Ruby core. Closes #78
Tag 1.1.0 release
Allow the transitions / known states for an event to be reset
Add fire_#{name}_event instance method for firing an arbitrary event on a state machine
Fix travis-ci configuration for exclusions and env params
Improve InvalidTransition exception messages to include the failure reason(s) in ORM integrations. Closes #138
Add jruby to travis-ci configuration
Don't allow around_transitions to attempt to be called in multiple execution contexts when run in jruby
Update appraisals for testing with jruby
Add Ruby 1.9.3 to travis-ci configuration
Refresh appraisal gemfiles and required ruby versions for appraisals using updated dependencies
Allow :from option to be used in transitions defined within state contexts
Fix arguments / block not being preserved when chaining methods defined in state contexts
Fix super not being allowed when a method is defined for multiple state contexts. Closes #140
Minor refactor of eval helpers
Change loopbacks to only cause objects to be persisted when the ORM decides it's necessary, instead of always forcing persistence
Update appraisal gemfiles
Fix Mongoid 2.3.x integrations not initializing dynamic states in the same manner as other integrations with initialize callbacks
Tag v1.0.3 release
Avoid version matching issues with comparing strings in Mongoid integrations
Fix MongoMapper 0.10.0+ integrations not matching versions properly
Add appraisal for Sequel 3.29.0
Update warnings for method conflicts to include instructions on how to ignore conflicts
Rename old mongoid 2.2.0 appraisal
Fix appraisal name for mongoid 2.2.4
Fix state initialization in Mongoid 2.3.x integrations. Closes #125
Fix after_transition callbacks sometimes not running in Mongoid 2.2.x integrations. Closes #126
Add mongoid 2.2.0 / 2.3.3 appraisals
Add active_model 3.1.1 appraisal
Automatically load the plugins required in Sequel integrations
Add docs on how to create records in after_failure callbacks when used within transactions in ORM integrations. Closes #122
Allow all / any matcher helpers to be used when defining states / events. Closes #120
Allow states / events to be referenced by the string equivalent of their name.  Closes #9
Also remove ruby 1.9.1 from travis ci as it is not supported anymore

Merge pull request #133 from slainer68/patch-1

Remove ruby 1.8.6 from travis ci as it is not supported anymore
Removes ruby 1.8.6 from travis ci as it is not supported anymore.
Add / clarify examples for defining callbacks for the initial state.  Closes #117
Ignore the FILE option in the state_machine:draw rake task for Rails / Merb integrations since files get automatically loaded when referencing the class.  Closes #131
Fix syntax error in dynamic definition example
Update dynamic definition example to demonstrate how to persist state changes.  Closes #132

Fix observer callbacks being run incorrectly when using nil states in ActiveModel-based integrations
Add tests proving that translations work for nil states
Remove ActiveModel Observer method chains in order to better ensure compatibility
Add appraisal for ActiveRecord 3.1.1
Update DataMapper integration for 1.2.0+ support.  Closes #106

Output more debugging details when ruby-graphviz fails to load
Add appraisals for the various supported ruby-graphviz versions and remove from default appraisal
Provide access to the human state name in invalid_transition translations. Closes #114

Add support for i18n keys in the form of #{i18n_scope}.state_machines.#{model_name}.states/events.#{value}
Document i18n usage for ActiveModel, MongoMapper, and Mongoid
Add changelog entries on doc updates
Clarify the behavior of can_#{event} and #{event}_transition helpers.  Closes #112
Set the markup provider as redcarpet in yardopts in order to render the GitHub syntax highlighting markup correcly. Closes #115
Avoid double negatives in README conditional examples
Clarify README examples on state-driven behaviors and transition conditionals.  Closes #113
Add caveat on using dynamic initial states and factory_girl
Convert README / CHANGELOG to markdown. Closes #108
Fix whitespace
Add docs explaining reading from and writing to state machine attributes
Provide an example for dynamically generated state machines
Tag v1.0.2 release
Clarify that you can continue to define state-driven behaviors using one of the alternative syntaxes
Allow transitions to be defined within a state, event, or machine context.  Closes #10

Tag v1.0.1 release
Add the ability to ignore method conflicts for helpers
Generate warnings for any helper, not just state helpers, that has a conflicting method defined in the class [#79 state:resolved]
Fix scopes in Sequel not working if the table name contains double underscores or is not a string/symbol
Add full support for chaining state scopes within Sequel integrations
Use #exclude instead of #filter with ~ syntax for generating without_state scopes in Sequel
Fix Rails 3.1 deprecation warnings for configuring engine locales
Tag v1.0.0 release
Tag v0.10.4 release
Raise StateMachine::IntegrationNotFound when an integration is missing instead of NameError
Fix translations not being available under certain environments in Rails applications [#67 state:resolved]
Allow the availability of integrations to be queried instead of attempting to match them against a class
Look up integrations using their defined integration name instead of via const lookup
Move the definition of integration names to the Base integration
Make the active integration available to machine instances
Tag 0.10.3 release
Fix state initialization failing in ActiveRecord 3.0.2+ when using with_state scopes for the default scope [#75 state:resolved]
Add notes in README on Mongoid observers
Tag 0.10.2 release

Use more integrated state initialization hooks for ActiveRecord, Mongoid, and Sequel
Remove mass-assignment filtering usage in all ORM integrations
Only support official Mongoid 2.0.0 release and up (no more RC support)
Fix attributes getting initialized more than once if different state machines use the same attribute
Fix the line number specified for some places using string evaluation
Only initialize states if state is blank and blank is not a valid state

Simplify helpers by allowing the use of string evaluation
- Fixes helpers failing when used with certain libraries (such as Thin) [#74 state:resolved]
Add docs on integrating with Mongoid Observers
Move ActiveRecord Observer hooks to legacy 2.x versions
Tag 0.10.1 release

Fix ActiveRecord tests failing in ActiveRecord 3.1+
Support callback terminators in MongoMapper 0.9.0+

Refactor pausing / resuming of around_transition callbacks

Use attribute-based event transitions whenever possible to ensure consistency

Uncomment empty line

Tag 0.7.6 release

Tag 0.4.0 release
Add examples directory to gems

Add Sequel support

Don't stringify to/from/event values for transitions
Update Rakefile description
Add next_#{event}_transition for getting the next transition that would be performed if the event were fired
Add missing CHANGELOG comments
Clarify CHANGELOG comments

Re-design to be library-agnostic (define state machines on any Ruby class, with integration support for ActiveRecord and DataMapper)
* Use a class containing the transition context in callbacks, rather than an ordered list of each individual attribute
* Add the ability for the state change action (e.g. +save+ for ActiveRecord) to be configurable
* Add the ability to skip state change actions during a transition (e.g. vehicle.ignite(false))
* Only generate the known states for a machine on demand, rather than calculating beforehand
* Include states referenced in transition callbacks in the list of a machine's known states
* Add support for using real blocks in before_transition/after_transition calls instead of using the :do option
* Add support for dynamic to states in transitions (e.g. :to => lambda {Time.now})
Add missing owner from changelog message
Add changelog message for without_#{attribute} named scopes
Tag 0.3.1 release
Update Factory helpers to handle protected attributes
Fix the initial state not getting set when the state attribute is mass-assigned but protected
Fix state machine examples in README to match output. [#2 state:resolved]
Change how the base module is included to prevent namespacing conflicts
Clean up rake tasks
Tag 0.3.0 release

MAJOR REWRITE! Replace all before/after_exit/enter/loopback callback hooks and :before/:after options for events with before_transition/after_transition callbacks
Fix state machines in subclasses not knowing what states/events/transitions were defined by superclasses
Don't use callbacks for performing transitions
Add support for can_#{event}? for checking whether an event can be fired based on the current state of the record
No longer allow additional arguments to be passed into event actions
Ensure named scopes are symbols for cross-platform 2.1 compatibility
Always save when an event is fired even if it results in a loopback
Add documentation about defining callbacks
Spelling fixes
Ensure initial state callbacks are invoked in the proper order when an event is fired on a new record
Add before_loopback and after_loopback hooks
Fix incomplete example in PluginAWeek::StateMachine::Machine#event

Add more descriptive exceptions
Assume the default state attribute is "state" if one is not provided

Completely rewritten from scratch
Renamed to state_machine
Removed database dependencies
Removed models in favor of an attribute-agnostic design
Use ActiveSupport::Callbacks instead of eval_call
Remove dry_transaction_rollbacks dependencies
Added functional tests
Updated documentation
Update README format
Prepare release dates/versions
Fix instructions in README for migration plugins use the plugin_migration generator
Update gem dependencies
Add dependency on custom_callbacks
Describing installation instructions is outside the scope of the README
Fix source and development links
More documentation

Move test fixtures out of the test application root directory
Improve documentation
Remove the StateExtension module in favor of adding singleton methods to the stateful class
update list of files to include in Gem.
Convert dos newlines to unix newlines
Fix error message when a given event can't be found in the database.

Add before_#{action} and #{action} callbacks when an event is performed.
All state and event callbacks can now explicitly return false in order to cancel the action.
Refactor ActiveState callback creation.
Refactor unit tests so that they use mock classes instead of themselves.

Allow force_reload option to be set in the state association.
Don't save the entire model when updating the state_id.

Raise exception if a class tries to define a state more than once.
Add tests for PluginAWeek::Has::States::ActiveState.
Refactor active state/active event creation.
Fix owner_type not being set correctly in active states/events of subclasses.
Allow subclasses to override the initial state.
Fix problem with migrations using default null when column cannot be null.
Remove old transition mock since it's no longer needed.
Update migration formats so that they're more maintainable.
More documentation fixes (many more doc updates needed, though).
Fix documented syntax.
Initial release

Moved deadline support into a separate plugin (has_state_deadlines).
Added many more unit tests.
Simplified many of the interfaces for maintainability.
Added support for turning off recording state changes.
Removed the short_description and long_description columns, in favor of an optional human_name column.
Fixed not overriding the correct equality methods in the StateTransition class.
Added to_sym to State and Event.
State#name and Event#name now return the string version of the name instead of the symbol version.
Added State#human_name and Event#human_name to automatically figure out what the human name is if it isn't specified in the table.
Updated manual rollbacks to use the new Rails edge api (ActiveRecord::Rollback exception)
Moved StateExtension class into a separate file in order to help keep the has_state files clean.
Renamed InvalidState and InvalidEvent exceptions to StateNotFound and EventNotFound in order to follow the ActiveRecord convention (i.e. RecordNotFound).
Added StateNotActive and EventNotActive exceptions to help differentiate between states which don't exist and states which weren't defined in the class.
Added support for defining callbacks like so:
  def before_exit_parked
  end
  
  def after_enter_idling
  end
Added support for defining callbacks using class methods:
  before_exit_parked :fasten_seatbelt
Added event callbacks after the transition has occurred (e.g. after_park)
State callbacks no longer receive any of the arguments that were provided in the event action
Updated license to include our names.
Add comments.
